page.title: 10FARMING IN THE AREA.
page.content: THERE ARE SIX FARMS IN THE AREA. {CRIBB'S FARM}AND{BUTCOMBE FARM}ARE BOTH DAIRY FARMS.{HOLT FARM}ONLY MAKES YOGHURT WHILE{SAGE FARM,BOURNE FARM AND{ALDWICK COURT FARM}ARE ALL MIXED. MOST OF THE FARMING IS GROWING CROPS BECAUSE THE SOIL IS GOOD; AND DAIRY FARMING BECAUSE THE GRAZING IS GOOD. JAMES KEEL'S DAD IS A FARMER. HE WORKS ON {BOURNE FARM.}ON THE FARM THEY HAVE ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY COWS AND ABOUT THE SAME NUMBER OF CALVES. THE COWS GET MILKED TWICE A DAY. ONCE IN THE MORNING AND ONCE IN THE AFTERNOON. THERE IS A VERY BIG TANK TO KEEP THE MILK COOL AND FRESH. EVERY MORNING A TANKER COMES TO COLLECT IT. HERE IS A LIST OF SOME OF THE MACHINERY THAT THAT IS USED ON THE FARM;A HAYBAILER,A TRACTOR,A SPRAYER,A PLOUGH,A SILAGER,A PLANTER AND MILK PUMPS.
